private_information: I am agent_1 and I may only pick up and move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi constraints: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
My identifier is agent_1 and move statements I produce must be prefixed with 'agent_1:'.
agent_1.goal: Cooperatively reach the target configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top->bottom) C; right peg has (top->bottom) A.

private_information: I am agent_2 and I may only pick up and move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
I must obey Tower of Hanoi constraints: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on a smaller disk.
My identifier is agent_2 and move statements I produce must be prefixed with 'agent_2:'.
agent_2.goal: Cooperatively reach the target configuration: left peg has (top->bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top->bottom) C; right peg has (top->bottom) A.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate proposals from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a final PDDL domain and problem suitable for FastDownwards that represents the cooperative 2-agent Tower of Hanoi instance and yields a valid plan respecting agent move restrictions.

public_information: This is a standard Tower of Hanoi with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
There are 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
The initial configuration on the left peg from top to bottom is A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O.
Both middle and right pegs are initially empty.
Legal moves consist of moving the top disk from one peg to another peg, one disk per move, and never placing a larger disk on top of a smaller disk.
The cooperative global goal is: left peg has (top->bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg has (top->bottom) C; right peg has (top->bottom) A.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. Using only your private ability to move disks A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that contributes to the global goal. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and do not attempt to move disks you are not authorized to move. Provide the minimal sequence of moves you propose for your controllable disks. Do not produce PDDL.

You are agent_2. Using only your private ability to move disks I, J, K, L, M, N, O, produce an ordered list of primitive moves that contributes to the global goal. Each move must be formatted exactly as 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and do not attempt to move disks you are not authorized to move. Provide the minimal sequence of moves you propose for your controllable disks. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Integrate the move proposals from agent_1 and agent_2 and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem targeted at the FastDownwards planner. The PDDL must model three pegs, 15 disks with sizes corresponding to labels A..O, legal single-disk moves, and agent-specific move permissions so that only agent_1 actions may move disks A..H and only agent_2 actions may move disks I..O. Keep actions distinct for each agent (for example, agent_1-move and agent_2-move). Use types, predicates, and action definitions compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Produce no other output.
pddl.prompt: You will receive two inputs: the ordered move list proposed by agent_1 as {moves_agent_1} and the ordered move list proposed by agent_2 as {moves_agent_2}. Use these proposals to validate, reconcile, and if necessary repair or reorder moves so the final PDDL domain and problem represent a solvable, agent-aware Tower of Hanoi instance that reaches the stated global goal. Ensure the PDDL encodes agent move restrictions, the initial configuration, and the goal configuration. Output the PDDL domain and problem only, wrapped in the required tags.
